clusters.title: Ex-South Korean president sentenced to life in prison over martial law order
clusters.neutral_headline: South Korean Ex President Sentenced To Life

items.title: Ex-South Korean president sentenced to life in prison over martial law order
items.standfirst: Yoon Suk Yeol, the impeached president of South Korea, was found guilty of insurrection and sentenced to life in prison over his failed attempt to impose martial law on the U.S. ally. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports on Suk Yeol's short-lived power grab that sent the Asian democracy into political turmoil in 2024.
items.content: Yoon Suk Yeol, the impeached president of South Korea, was found guilty of insurrection and sentenced to life in prison over his failed attempt to impose martial law on the U.S. ally. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports on Suk Yeol's short-lived power grab that sent the Asian democracy into political turmoil in 2024.

items.title: What led to Yoon's life sentence? #world
items.standfirst: Verdict in historic insurrection trial A South Korean court convicted former president Yoon Suk‑yeol of leading an insurrection and sentenced him to life imprisonment for his role in declaring a brief period of martial law late in 2024. Judges found that the short‑lived decree — which involved…
items.content: Verdict in historic insurrection trial A South Korean court convicted former president Yoon Suk‑yeol of leading an insurrection and sentenced him to life imprisonment for his role in declaring a brief period of martial law late in 2024. Judges found that the short‑lived decree — which involved…

items.title: South Korea's ex-president jailed for life over martial law attempt
items.standfirst: Yoon Suk Yeol's December 2024 martial law bid fundamentally damaged South Korea's democracy, a judge told the court.
items.content: Yoon Suk Yeol's December 2024 martial law bid fundamentally damaged South Korea's democracy, a judge told the court.

items.title: South Korea’s former president Yoon Suk Yeol jailed for life for leading insurrection
items.standfirst: Ex-leader sentenced to life imprisonment with hard labour over failed martial law declaration in 2024A South Korean court has sentenced the former president Yoon Suk Yeol to life imprisonment with labour over his failed martial law declaration in December 2024, finding him guilty of leading an insurrection and making him the first elected head of state in the country’s democratic era to receive the maximum custodial sentence.The Seoul central district court found that Yoon’s declaration of martial law on 3 December 2024 constituted insurrection, carried out with the intent to disrupt the constitutional order. Continue reading...
items.content: Ex-leader sentenced to life imprisonment with hard labour over failed martial law declaration in 2024A South Korean court has sentenced the former president Yoon Suk Yeol to life imprisonment with labour over his failed martial law declaration in December 2024, finding him guilty of leading an insurrection and making him the first elected head of state in the country’s democratic era to receive the maximum custodial sentence.The Seoul central district court found that Yoon’s declaration of martial law on 3 December 2024 constituted insurrection, carried out with the intent to disrupt the constitutional order. Continue reading...

items.title: Former South Korean president handed life sentence
items.standfirst: A South Korean court has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison after he imposed martial law in the country in 2024.
items.content: A South Korean court has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison after he imposed martial law in the country in 2024.

items.title: Ex-South Korean president found guilty of insurrection over martial law order
items.standfirst: Yoon Suk Yeol, the impeached former president of South Korea, was found guilty of insurrection and sentenced to life in prison on Thursday over his failed attempt to impose martial law on the U.S. ally
items.content: Yoon Suk Yeol, the impeached former president of South Korea, was found guilty of insurrection and sentenced to life in prison on Thursday over his failed attempt to impose martial law on the U.S. ally

ai_summary: Yoon Suk Yeol sentenced to life imprisonment
Found guilty of leading an insurrection
First elected head to receive maximum sentence

clusters.title: Macron and Meloni clash over killing of French far-right activist in Lyon
clusters.neutral_headline: Macron And Meloni Clash Over Activist Killing

items.title: Macron and Meloni clash over killing of French far-right activist in Lyon
items.standfirst: A war of words has erupted between the French president and Italian prime minister over the murder of Quentin Deranque.
items.content: A war of words has erupted between the French president and Italian prime minister over the murder of Quentin Deranque.

items.title: Macron asks Meloni not to 'comment' on France's affairs after activist remark
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday called on Giorgia Meloni to stop "commenting on what is happening in other people's countries," after the Italian prime minister expressed shock at the fatal beating of a far-right activist in France. Quentin Deranque, 23, died from head injuries after being attacked by at least six people last week on the sidelines of a far-right protest at a university in the city of Lyon. FRANCE 24's Seema Gupta reports from Rome.
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday called on Giorgia Meloni to stop "commenting on what is happening in other people's countries," after the Italian prime minister expressed shock at the fatal beating of a far-right activist in France. Quentin Deranque, 23, died from head injuries after being attacked by at least six people last week on the sidelines of a far-right protest at a university in the city of Lyon. FRANCE 24's Seema Gupta reports from Rome.

items.title: French prosecutor seeks murder charges over killing of far-right activist
items.standfirst: Political tensions rise after fatal attack at protest in Lyon as Emmanuel Macron hits out over remarks by Italian PMA French prosecutor is seeking murder charges against seven suspects in the fatal beating of a far-right activist that has fuelled political anger beyond France’s borders, prompting Emmanuel Macron to tell Italy’s Giorgia Meloni to keep out of French affairs.Quentin Deranque, 23, died from head injuries after being attacked by at least six people on the sidelines of a far-right protest in Lyon on 12 February. Most of the 11 suspects who have been detained are from far-left movements. Continue reading...
items.content: Political tensions rise after fatal attack at protest in Lyon as Emmanuel Macron hits out over remarks by Italian PMA French prosecutor is seeking murder charges against seven suspects in the fatal beating of a far-right activist that has fuelled political anger beyond France’s borders, prompting Emmanuel Macron to tell Italy’s Giorgia Meloni to keep out of French affairs.Quentin Deranque, 23, died from head injuries after being attacked by at least six people on the sidelines of a far-right protest in Lyon on 12 February. Most of the 11 suspects who have been detained are from far-left movements. Continue reading...

items.title: Two suspects charged over killing of French far-right activist Quentin Deranque
items.standfirst: A French court on Thursday brought homicide charges against two suspects in the fatal beating of far-right activist Quentin Deranque, 23, after violent clashes in the French city of Lyon. Most of those detained are from far-left movements.
items.content: A French court on Thursday brought homicide charges against two suspects in the fatal beating of far-right activist Quentin Deranque, 23, after violent clashes in the French city of Lyon. Most of those detained are from far-left movements.

items.title: Macron asks Meloni not to 'comment' on France's affairs after activist remark
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday called on Italy's Giorgia Meloni to keep out of France's affairs amid anger over the killing of French far-right activist Quentin Deranque, 23.
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday called on Italy's Giorgia Meloni to keep out of France's affairs amid anger over the killing of French far-right activist Quentin Deranque, 23.

ai_summary: Macron asks Meloni not to comment
Tensions rise between France and Italy

clusters.title: RSF siege of El Fasher in Sudan has ‘hallmarks of genocide’, UN mission finds
clusters.neutral_headline: Sudan Atrocities Have Hallmarks Of Genocide

items.title: RSF siege of El Fasher in Sudan has ‘hallmarks of genocide’, UN mission finds
items.standfirst: Report details harrowing 18-month occupation of North Darfur capital, showing destruction aimed at ethnic communitiesThe siege and capture of the Sudanese city of El Fasher by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces group last October bore “the hallmarks of genocide”, a UN-mandated fact-finding mission has said.In a report detailing the harrowing 18-month occupation of the capital of North Darfur, investigators concluded that the RSF and allied militias deliberately inflicted conditions calculated to bring about the physical destruction of the Zaghawa and Fur ethnic communities. Continue reading...
items.content: Report details harrowing 18-month occupation of North Darfur capital, showing destruction aimed at ethnic communitiesThe siege and capture of the Sudanese city of El Fasher by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces group last October bore “the hallmarks of genocide”, a UN-mandated fact-finding mission has said.In a report detailing the harrowing 18-month occupation of the capital of North Darfur, investigators concluded that the RSF and allied militias deliberately inflicted conditions calculated to bring about the physical destruction of the Zaghawa and Fur ethnic communities. Continue reading...

items.title: Sudan atrocities are 'hallmarks of genocide', UN says
items.standfirst: A UN fact-finding mission issued the report after investigating the capture of el-Fasher by the Rapid Support Forces.
items.content: A UN fact-finding mission issued the report after investigating the capture of el-Fasher by the Rapid Support Forces.

items.title: Mass killings of non-Arab civilians in Sudan's El-Fasher point to 'genocide', UN report says
items.standfirst: Mass killings of non-Arab civilians in El-Fasher after its capture by Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) show signs consistent with genocide, according to a new report by the UN Independent International Fact-Finding Mission for Sudan.
items.content: Mass killings of non-Arab civilians in El-Fasher after its capture by Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) show signs consistent with genocide, according to a new report by the UN Independent International Fact-Finding Mission for Sudan.

ai_summary: UN report details El Fasher siege

items.content: Testifying before Congress, the former CEO of Victoria's Secret lingerie brand accused Epstein of stealing "vast sums" of money from his family.

items.title: Ex-Victoria's Secret mogul says Epstein 'stole vast sums from our family'
items.standfirst: A billionaire mogul says paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein stole vast sums from his family.
items.content: A billionaire mogul says paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein stole vast sums from his family.

items.title: Billionaire Les Wexner testifies before Congress about ties to Epstein
items.standfirst: Wexner, who has denied misconduct related to Epstein, is one of several subpoenaed by House oversight panelThe former boss of the Victoria’s Secret lingerie brand, Les Wexner, said he has “done nothing wrong” and has “nothing to hide”, as he testifies on Wednesday before a congressional committee in relation to his past ties to Jeffrey Epstein.Wexner is one of several Epstein associates subpoenaed to testify before the House oversight committee in their continued investigation of the late financier’s crimes. Continue reading...
items.content: Wexner, who has denied misconduct related to Epstein, is one of several subpoenaed by House oversight panelThe former boss of the Victoria’s Secret lingerie brand, Les Wexner, said he has “done nothing wrong” and has “nothing to hide”, as he testifies on Wednesday before a congressional committee in relation to his past ties to Jeffrey Epstein.Wexner is one of several Epstein associates subpoenaed to testify before the House oversight committee in their continued investigation of the late financier’s crimes. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Epstein stole vast sums from Wexner family
Testifying about past ties to Epstein

items.title: U.S. military pushes more weaponry into the Middle East for possible strikes on Iran
items.standfirst: WASHINGTON — The Defense Department is sending a large array of additional weaponry to the Middle East, including more warships, air defenses and submarines, in preparation for a possible military strike on Iran if President Donald Trump makes that decision, according to U.S. officials and information from public tracking.
items.content: WASHINGTON — The Defense Department is sending a large array of additional weaponry to the Middle East, including more warships, air defenses and submarines, in preparation for a possible military strike on Iran if President Donald Trump makes that decision, according to U.S. officials and information from public tracking.

ai_summary: US deploys forces to Middle East
Carrier strike groups moved into position
US prepares for possible military action

clusters.title: Hosts Italy voice ‘absolute opposition’ to Russia flag flying at Winter Paralympics
clusters.neutral_headline: Italy Opposes Russian Flag At Paralympics

items.title: Hosts Italy voice ‘absolute opposition’ to Russia flag flying at Winter Paralympics
items.standfirst: Italian government urges IPC to reconsider its stanceRussian and Belarusian athletes to compete under flagsItaly, the Winter Olympic hosts, has called for a reversal of the decision to let 10 Russian and Belarusian athletes compete with national flags and anthems at next month’s Paralympic Games.The foreign minister Antonio Tajani and sports minister Andrea Abodi urged the International Paralympic Committee to reconsider its stance due to Russia’s four-year-old invasion of Ukraine, saying it contradicted the Olympic spirit. Continue reading...
items.content: Italian government urges IPC to reconsider its stanceRussian and Belarusian athletes to compete under flagsItaly, the Winter Olympic hosts, has called for a reversal of the decision to let 10 Russian and Belarusian athletes compete with national flags and anthems at next month’s Paralympic Games.The foreign minister Antonio Tajani and sports minister Andrea Abodi urged the International Paralympic Committee to reconsider its stance due to Russia’s four-year-old invasion of Ukraine, saying it contradicted the Olympic spirit. Continue reading...

items.title: Ukraine officials to boycott Paralympics for letting Russians compete under their flag
items.standfirst: Ukraine said Wednesday that its officials will not attend the Winter Paralympics next month over organizers’ decision to allow a handful of Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their flags
items.content: Ukraine said Wednesday that its officials will not attend the Winter Paralympics next month over organizers’ decision to allow a handful of Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their flags

ai_summary: Italy opposes Russian flag at Paralympics
Russia allowed to compete under flag

clusters.title: More than 1,000 Kenyans lured to fight for Russia in Ukraine war, report says
clusters.neutral_headline: Over 1000 Kenyans Lured To Fight In Ukraine

items.title: More than 1,000 Kenyans lured to fight for Russia in Ukraine war, report says
items.standfirst: Intelligence findings read to parliament say ‘rogue’ agencies and individuals recruiting Kenyan nationals to frontlineMore than 1,000 Kenyans have been lured to fight for Russia in its war with Ukraine, according to an intelligence report to the Kenyan parliament that highlights the scale of a Russian operation taking African men to the frontline.The majority leader of Kenya’s national assembly, Kimani Ichung’wah, said “rogue recruitment agencies and individuals in Kenya” were continuing to send Kenyan nationals to fight in the conflict, as he read MPs the summary of an investigation by Kenya’s National Intelligence Service. Continue reading...
items.content: Intelligence findings read to parliament say ‘rogue’ agencies and individuals recruiting Kenyan nationals to frontlineMore than 1,000 Kenyans have been lured to fight for Russia in its war with Ukraine, according to an intelligence report to the Kenyan parliament that highlights the scale of a Russian operation taking African men to the frontline.The majority leader of Kenya’s national assembly, Kimani Ichung’wah, said “rogue recruitment agencies and individuals in Kenya” were continuing to send Kenyan nationals to fight in the conflict, as he read MPs the summary of an investigation by Kenya’s National Intelligence Service. Continue reading...

items.title: Over 1,000 Kenyans enlisted to fight in Russia-Ukraine war, report says
items.standfirst: Investigators call the recruitment a well-organised trafficking ring involving immigration staff and security agencies.
items.content: Investigators call the recruitment a well-organised trafficking ring involving immigration staff and security agencies.

ai_summary: Kenyans recruited to fight for Russia
